p: Erythropoiesis is considered to play critical roles in hematopoiesis, by which production of red blood cells (RBCs) is occurred. In this process, EPO, a RBC-specific hormone, is able to regulate erythropoiesis in bone marrow ( Ascensao et al., 1991). EPO gene expression regulates primarily at the level of transcription, and which is further controlled by a number of transcriptional and post-transcriptional factors ( Schuster et al., 1989; Goldberg et al., 1991). Failure to up regulate the circulating EPO under hypoxia thereafter leads to anemia ( Jelkmann, 1992). Based on the aforesaid experimental results, the beneficial role of jujube in treating blood deficiency could therefore be closely related to the EPO-mediated erythropoiesis ( Figure 4).
